msItem.title: Psalter (portable)
msItem.note: Beginning impefect at Ps.2:1 due to the loss of the first leaf; lacking Pss. 17:15–49:7 due to the loss of quires after fol. 22; lacking Pss.50:4–52:6 due to the loss of three leaves after fol. 25; lacking Pss.67:36–68:6 due to the loss of a leaf after fol. 49; lacking Pss.96:5–97:1 due to the loss of a leaf after fol. 112; and lacking Ps.109 due to the loss of a leaf before fol. 146. Offsets of decoration on fol. 212v suggest that the psalms were originally followed by another text, probably a Litany (and other texts?), and it is also likely that a calendar originally preceded the first extant quire.

supportDesc.extent:
i (modern parchment) + 209 + ii (modern parchment) leaves. 135 100
90 60
Edges cropped by binder.
supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in modern pencil, corrected in 1999: i, 1–8, 9a-b, 10–44, 46–91, 93–182, 184–201, 203–214 (i.e. '9' is repeated, but '45', '92', '183' and '202' are omitted).
supportDesc.collation: 1(8) (wants 1), 2(8), 3(8) (several quires missing after 3), 4(8) (wants 3–6), 5(8), 6(8), 7(8) (wants 7), 8(8)–14(8), 15(8) (wants 6), 16(8)–18(8), 19(8) (8 canc.), 20(8) (wants 1, offset of decoration on fol. 145v) 21(8)–26(8), 27(10)(or 8+2, 9 and 10 inserted?)traces of catchwords occasionally survive (e.g. fols. 122v, 130v)

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in dark brown ink with 15 lines, of which the top and bottom ones extend the full width of the page, between single vertical bounding lines extending the full height of the page. 14 lines of text.

decoDesc.decoNote: Most of the leaves which would have borne major initials are missing, only one survives: (fol. 81v) Psalm 80: Six-line initial 'E'[xultate] in blue with white decoration and multi-coloured foliate scrolls, on a cusped gold ground; a gold bar runs the height of the text in the outer margin, extending into ivy-leaf sprays in the upper and lower margins.
Psalms with two-line initials alternately in blue with red penwork, or vice versa.
Verses with one-line initials alternately plain red or blue.

binding.p: Bound in 20th-cent. dark green leather; the spine with four narrow raised bands, and tooled in gilt 'PSALTERIUM' and 'SAEC XIV'.

history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian by C. M. Firth, 1931.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff, revised by Peter Kidd, late 1990s. For more recent description see Elizabeth Solopova, Latin Liturgical Psalters in the Bodleian Library: A Select Catalogue (Oxford, 2013), pp. 310–12.

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 2: Office Books (typescript, 1957), p. 80

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
